entry.title: Re: Electronic Invoices for Malaysia: A Guide for Communication Settings
entry.content: Hi @gerhardhoebinger, the certificate from certified vendors, did it include Digital Signature capabilities? and were you connecting to IRBM Malaysia XML version 1.1 or 1.0? Coz our understanding is that version 1.0 does not include Digital Signature capabilities, hence would not require certificate configuration. Version 1.1 is the IRBM version that includes Digital Signature capabilities that would require Digital Signature Certificate from certified vendors.

entry.title: CDS View as DataSource for BW/B4HANA & CDS Implemented via AMDP method to support complex logic
entry.content:
In S4HANA system, We need a ABAP CDS view to be developed as DataSource  for the B4HANA system consumption. But there are limitations in ABAP CDS view and to overcome we can implement the CDS view via AMDP method and class. This blog explains the same so in case of complex transformation we can use the AMDP method in CDS to handle those complex scenarios. 

Below are the steps to be followed

Create a class which implement "IF_AMDP_MARKER_HDB" interface. In my case my class name is ZBW4_FI_TREASURYITEMCOUNTER_01.

add a static method to implement the logic for CDS. In my case i have used the method "TREASURYITEMCOUNTER"

Inside the method i have used the below code 

method treasuryitemcounter by database function for hdb language sqlscript using vtbfhapo vtbfha usr21 adrp tzb0t but000 t001 adrc.
/*
The tables used for the logic must be added in method signature after "using" keyword.
Company Code,
Financial Transaction and Fiscal year are concatenated to get transaction_id column.
*/

lt_vtbghapo = select VTBFHAPO.MANDT as client_element_name,
                         concat(concat(VTBFHAPO.BUKRS,right(VTBFHAPO.RFHA,10)),left(VTBFHAPO.GJAHR,4)) transaction_id,
                         vtbfhapo.bukrs as vtbfhapo_bukrs ,
                         vtbfhapo.rfha as vtbfhapo_rfha,
                         vtbfhapo.rantyp as vtbfhapo_rantyp,
                         vtbfhapo.ssign as vtbfhapo_ssign,
                         vtbfhapo.sbfrei as vtbfhapo_sbfrei,
                         vtbfhapo.dzterm as vtbfhapo_dzterm,
                         vtbfha.merkm as vtbfha_merkm,
                         vtbfha.merkm as Description,
                         vtbfhapo.cruser as VTBFHAPO_cruser,
                         usr21.bname as usr21_bname,
                         adrp.name_text as adrp_name_text,
                         adrp.name_text as Username,
                         vtbfhapo.sfhazba as VTBFHAPO_SFHAZBA,
                         tzb0t.rantyp as TZB0T_RANTYP,
                         tzb0t.sbewart as TZB0T_SBEWART,
                         tzb0t.XBEWART as FlowCategory,
                         vtbfhapo.wzbetr as VTBFHAPO_WZBETR,
                         vtbfhapo.wzbetr as Currency,
                         vtbfhapo.cruser as EnteredBy,
                         vtbfha.kontrh as VTBFHA_KONTRH,
                         but000.partner as BUT000_PARTNER,
                         but000.name_org1 as BUT000_NAME_ORG1,
                         but000.name_org1 as PartnerName,
                         '' as Vendor,
                         '' as VendorName,
                         vtbfhapo.bukrs as Customer,
                         t001.bukrs as T001_BUKRS,
                         adrc.name1 as ADRC_NAME1,
                         adrc.name1 as CustomerName,
                         left(VTBFHAPO.GJAHR,4) as FiscalYear,
                         vtbfha.dblfz as DocumentDate,
                         vtbfhapo.dbuchung as PostingDate,
                         vtbfhapo.dzterm as DueDate,
                         vtbfhapo.dzterm as AdjustedDueDate,
                         vtbfhapo.dzterm as TransactionDate,
                         'Treasury' as Team,
                         vtbfhapo.bzbetr as VTBFHAPO_BZBETR,
                         vtbfhapo.bzbetr as ActualAmount
                         from VTBFHAPO
                         left outer join
                         vtbfha --Transaction Table
                         on
                         vtbfha.rfha = vtbfhapo.rfha and
                         vtbfha.bukrs = vtbfhapo.bukrs AND
                         vtbfha.MANDT = Session_context('CLIENT')
                         left outer join
                         usr21
                         on
                         usr21.bname  = vtbfhapo.cruser AND
                         usr21.MANDT = Session_context('CLIENT')
                         left outer join
                         adrp
                         on
                         adrp.persnumber = usr21.persnumber AND
                         adrp.CLIENT = Session_context('CLIENT')
                         left outer join
                         tzb0t
                         on
                         tzb0t.rantyp = vtbfhapo.rantyp and
                         tzb0t.sbewart = vtbfhapo.sfhazba and
                         tzb0t.sspras = 'E' AND
                         tzb0t.MANDT = Session_context('CLIENT')
                         left outer join
                         but000
                         on
                         but000.PARTNER = vtbfha.kontrh AND
                         but000.CLIENT = Session_context('CLIENT')
                         left outer join
                         t001
                         on
                         t001.bukrs = vtbfhapo.bukrs and
                         t001.MANDT = Session_context('CLIENT')
                         left outer join
                         adrc
                         on
                         adrc.addrnumber = t001.adrnr and
                         adrc.CLIENT = Session_context('CLIENT')
                         where
                         VTBFHAPO.MANDT = Session_context('CLIENT');

/* 
In local table lt_vtbghapo_01 we try to get the rownumber as "counter", for the previously derived column "transaction_id" at local table lt_vtbghapo. Pad it in left with 000
*/
    lt_vtbghapo_01 = select *,
                            LPAD(row_number( ) over (
                                 PARTITION by transaction_id order by  transaction_id ASC) ,3,0
                                ) as counter
                            from :lt_vtbghapo;
/* In local table "lt_vtbghapo_02" we again concatenate the generated row number for every transaction id */ 
    lt_vtbghapo_02 = select client_element_name,
                            concat(transaction_id,counter) as transaction_id,
                            VTBFHAPO_BUKRS,
                            VTBFHAPO_RFHA,
                            VTBFHAPO_RANTYP,
                            VTBFHAPO_SSIGN,
                            VTBFHAPO_SBFREI,
                            VTBFHAPO_DZTERM,
                            VTBFHA_MERKM,
                            DESCRIPTION,
                            VTBFHAPO_CRUSER,
                            USR21_BNAME,
                            ADRP_NAME_TEXT,
                            USERNAME,
                            VTBFHAPO_SFHAZBA,
                            TZB0T_RANTYP,
                            TZB0T_SBEWART,
                            FLOWCATEGORY,
                            VTBFHAPO_WZBETR,
                            CURRENCY,
                            ENTEREDBY,
                            VTBFHA_KONTRH,
                            BUT000_PARTNER,
                            BUT000_NAME_ORG1,
                            PARTNERNAME,
                            VENDOR,
                            VENDORNAME,
                            CUSTOMER,
                            T001_BUKRS,
                            ADRC_NAME1,
                            CUSTOMERNAME,
                            FISCALYEAR,
                            DOCUMENTDATE,
                            POSTINGDATE,
                            DUEDATE,
                            ADJUSTEDDUEDATE,
                            TRANSACTIONDATE,
                            TEAM,
                            VTBFHAPO_BZBETR,
                            ACTUALAMOUNT
                            from :lt_vtbghapo_01;

/* make sure the return matches the CDS needs. This return statement is important and must contain all the columns that are needed for the CDS view*/
    return select client_element_name,
                  transaction_id,
                  VTBFHAPO_BUKRS,
                            VTBFHAPO_RFHA,
                            VTBFHAPO_RANTYP,
                            VTBFHAPO_SSIGN,
                            VTBFHAPO_SBFREI,
                            VTBFHAPO_DZTERM,
                            VTBFHA_MERKM,
                            DESCRIPTION,
                            VTBFHAPO_CRUSER,
                            USR21_BNAME,
                            ADRP_NAME_TEXT,
                            USERNAME,
                            VTBFHAPO_SFHAZBA,
                            TZB0T_RANTYP,
                            TZB0T_SBEWART,
                            FLOWCATEGORY,
                            VTBFHAPO_WZBETR,
                            CURRENCY,
                            ENTEREDBY,
                            VTBFHA_KONTRH,
                            BUT000_PARTNER,
                            BUT000_NAME_ORG1,
                            PARTNERNAME,
                            VENDOR,
                            VENDORNAME,
                            CUSTOMER,
                            T001_BUKRS,
                            ADRC_NAME1,
                            CUSTOMERNAME,
                            FISCALYEAR,
                            DOCUMENTDATE,
                            POSTINGDATE,
                            DUEDATE,
                            ADJUSTEDDUEDATE,
                            TRANSACTIONDATE,
                            TEAM,
                            VTBFHAPO_BZBETR,
                            ACTUALAMOUNT from :lt_vtbghapo_02;

  endmethod.

Now the logic has been implemented in the method. We need to link this method and class to the ABAP CDS. To do so you need to create table function as given below which is implemented by above method.

The columns returned by the method and must match the "returns" mentioned in "table function" in the same sequence.

 

@EndUserText.label: 'BW4: FI TR Transaction ID Counter'
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
define table function ZTFITRDOCCOUN01F
returns
{
  client_element_name : abap.clnt;
  transaction_id      : abap.char( 24 );
  VTBFHAPO_BUKRS      : bukrs;
  VTBFHAPO_RFHA       : tb_rfha;
  VTBFHAPO_RANTYP     : rantyp;
  VTBFHAPO_SSIGN      : tb_ssign;
  VTBFHAPO_SBFREI     : tb_sbfrei;
  VTBFHAPO_DZTERM     : tb_dzterm;
  VTBFHA_MERKM        : tb_merkm;
  DESCRIPTION         : tb_merkm;
  VTBFHAPO_CRUSER     : tb_cruser;
  USR21_BNAME         : xubname;
  ADRP_NAME_TEXT      : ad_namtext;
  USERNAME            : ad_namtext;
  VTBFHAPO_SFHAZBA    : tb_sfhazba;
  TZB0T_RANTYP        : rantyp;
  TZB0T_SBEWART       : sbewart;
  FLOWCATEGORY        : xbewart;
  VTBFHAPO_WZBETR     : tb_wzbetr;
  CURRENCY            : tb_wzbetr;
  ENTEREDBY           : tb_cruser;
  VTBFHA_KONTRH       : tb_kunnr_new;
  BUT000_PARTNER      : bu_partner;
  BUT000_NAME_ORG1    : bu_nameor1;
  PARTNERNAME         : bu_nameor1;
  VENDOR              : abap.char( 1 );
  VENDORNAME          : abap.char( 1 );
  CUSTOMER            : bukrs;
  T001_BUKRS          : bukrs;
  ADRC_NAME1          : ad_name1;
  CUSTOMERNAME        : ad_name1;
  FISCALYEAR          : abap.numc( 4 );
  DOCUMENTDATE        : tb_dblfz;
  POSTINGDATE         : budat;
  DUEDATE             : tb_dzterm;
  ADJUSTEDDUEDATE     : tb_dzterm;
  TRANSACTIONDATE     : tb_dzterm;
  TEAM                : abap.char( 8 );
  VTBFHAPO_BZBETR     : tb_bzbetr;
  ACTUALAMOUNT        : tb_bzbetr;
}
implemented by method
  zbw4_fi_treasuryitemcounter_01=>treasuryitemcounter;

Now

* we have class and method which has implemented the logic

* we have table function that is implemented by the previously defined class and static method. 

Now final step we need to create the CDS view "ZVFIXXFORCAST03F" to be consumed by B4HANA system. This CDS view will read from above created table function. We can have additional logic or filters at CDS view level too.

@AbapCatalog.sqlViewName: 'ZVFIXXFORCAST03F'
@AbapCatalog.compiler.compareFilter: true
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED

@Analytics :{ dataCategory: #CUBE, dataExtraction.enabled: true }
@VDM.viewType : #CONSUMPTION
@OData.publish: true


define view ZCFIXXFORCAST03F as 
select from ZTFITRDOCCOUN01F
{
key transaction_id as TransactionID,
VTBFHAPO_BUKRS,
VTBFHAPO_RFHA,
VTBFHAPO_RANTYP,
VTBFHAPO_SSIGN,
VTBFHAPO_SBFREI,
VTBFHAPO_DZTERM,
VTBFHA_MERKM,
DESCRIPTION,
VTBFHAPO_CRUSER,
USR21_BNAME,
ADRP_NAME_TEXT,
USERNAME,
VTBFHAPO_SFHAZBA,
TZB0T_RANTYP,
TZB0T_SBEWART,
FLOWCATEGORY,
 @Semantics.currencyCode: true
VTBFHAPO_WZBETR,
 @Semantics.currencyCode: true
CURRENCY,
ENTEREDBY,
VTBFHA_KONTRH,
BUT000_PARTNER,
BUT000_NAME_ORG1,
PARTNERNAME,
VENDOR,
VENDORNAME,
CUSTOMER,
T001_BUKRS,
ADRC_NAME1,
CUSTOMERNAME,
FISCALYEAR,
DOCUMENTDATE,
POSTINGDATE,
DUEDATE,
ADJUSTEDDUEDATE as AdjustedDueDate,
TRANSACTIONDATE,
'Treasury' as Department,
TEAM,                                                    
@Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'VTBFHAPO_WZBETR'
case when VTBFHAPO_SSIGN = '-'
then VTBFHAPO_BZBETR * -1
else
VTBFHAPO_BZBETR end as VTBFHAPO_BZBETR,
@Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'CURRENCY'
case when VTBFHAPO_SSIGN = '-'
then VTBFHAPO_BZBETR * -1
else
VTBFHAPO_BZBETR end as ActualAmount 
} where 
( VTBFHAPO_RANTYP = '4' or
  VTBFHAPO_RANTYP = '5' or
  VTBFHAPO_RANTYP = '6' ) and
VTBFHAPO_SBFREI = 'X' and
VTBFHAPO_DZTERM >= $session. system_date

This way BW DataSource-->Referring "CDS View" -->Referring "Table Function" --> Referring "AMDP Static method"

The output is successful. 


Note - We have not only used CDS view as BW DataSource. Additionally we have consumed the same CDS for forecasting in SAP Analyics cloud.

entry.title: Re: How to set the "Material Origin" field to be checked...
entry.content: @Joey3 要在SAP S/4HANA公有云系统中配置物料主数据成本核算1视图的“物料来源”字段默认勾选，您必须使用扩展性 cockpit（事务代码：SPRO）定义一个自定义逻辑适配。具体方法是创建一个针对 MD_COCKPIT_AFTER_READ 这个BAdI的实现，并专门增强其 SET_DEFAULT_VALUES 方法。在此方法中，当在处理物料创建过程中的特定成本核算1视图时，您需要将值 'X'（代表已勾选）赋给 mkalb-origp 字段（该字段对应“物料来源”指示器）。此配置通过SAP云传输进行部署，可确保默认设置在全系统范围内应用，而无需修改标准SAP代码，遵循了云系统的应用内扩展指南。

entry.title: Re: No genera Arries las incapacidades
entry.content:
@Alex_Truper 

Con base en el análisis exhaustivo del problema descrito con los atrasos de Infonavit derivado de la implementación de la nota de SAP, la solución definitiva requiere un ajuste preciso dentro del esquema XPPR (Cálculo de Elementos de Pago y Deducción), específicamente en la lógica de procesamiento para los pagos por incapacidad.

El problema central es que el tipo de concepto /110 (base para el cálculo de la incapacidad) no se está formando correctamente, lo que hace que el sistema interprete el pago como una deducción corriente (/381) compensada por un pago (/561) en lugar de un concepto de atrasos. Para forzar el cálculo de atrasos (Opción 3 de la nota de SAP), debe modificar la Clase de Procesamiento 05 asignada a los tipos de concepto de incapacidad relevantes (e.g., /320 o sus derivados). Dentro de la operación en la regla X030 que actualmente genera el par /561//381, necesita insertar una función (probablemente NUMKI o una función similar que establezca el indicador de 'número de pagos') antes de la operación que crea el tipo de concepto de pago. Esta función debe asignar los atributos correctos para marcar el monto como atraso, asegurando que se direccione a través del proceso estándar de atrasos de Infonavit (tipos de concepto /8nn) y no por la ruta de liquidación inmediata. Concurrentemente, verifique en la Clase de Procesamiento 03 que el tipo de concepto de entrada esté correctamente marcado para su procesamiento como atraso en el esquema X020, y asegúrese de que el campo MODIF o el condicionamiento similar en la operación que crea /381 sea suprimido para prevenir la deducción errónea. Este cambio de configuración canalizará correctamente el monto through del framework de atrasos en lugar del bucle de deducción/compensación.

entry.title: Release Navigator for SAP Cloud ERP Private – What’s New in Q3 2025
entry.content:
Greetings Community!

I am excited to announce the upcoming 2025 FPS00 release for SAP Cloud ERP (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition), scheduled for October. To ensure a smooth transition and help you prepare for the upgrade, the release navigator for SAP Cloud ERP Private will be undergoing enhancements over the next month. These updates will include new UX features and content designed to support your readiness journey. As a reminder, all updates to the release navigator are completely automated and taken care by SAP Enterprise Support.

Topics

  1. Quick Links
  2. New Topics & Content
  3. New & Refreshed UX Features
  4. Release Navigator Innovation Plan
  5. Connect with Us

 

Click on the links below to access each resource:

 

Additional Sub-Topics for Supply Chain

In October, I am happy to share the expansion of our Supply Chain page with two new, highly requested sub-topics:

  1. Extended Warehouse Management (EWM)
  2. Transportation Management (TM)

Within these sub-topics, users will have access to curated release content aligned with the 2025 FPS00 updates. This enhancement aims to provide a more comprehensive and detailed resource hub, enabling you to stay informed about the latest developments in these critical areas of supply chain management.

 

Extended Warehouse Management for Supply Chain

Under the EWM sub-topic on the Supply Chain page, you will find the following resources:

  1. What’s New Viewer
  2. Release Blog
  3. Help Portal
  4. Onboarding Resource Center

 

Transportation Management for Supply Chain

Under the TM sub-topic on the Supply Chain page, you will find the following resources:

  1. What’s New Viewer
  2. Release Blog
  3. Help Portal
  4. Onboarding Resource Center

 

SAP Activate Interactive Framework for Upgrades

The SAP Activate Road Map serves as an indispensable guide for SAP Cloud ERP Private customers, expertly navigating them through the intricacies of upgrade phases, deliverables, tasks, and accelerators. Aligned with the SAP Cloud Framework, it clearly outlines responsibilities for customers and partners, facilitating enhanced features, robust security, and seamless collaboration under a unified governance model.

For those seeking a comprehensive view of the tasks required for a smooth upgrade, the interactive framework offers an intuitive solution. Users can select from a range of upgrade tasks to gain a clear understanding of the necessary steps, ensuring a well-organized and efficient upgrade process.

 

All Pages

Search

I am excited to introduce a new search button conveniently located in the shell bar of all pages, designed to help you quickly locate release content for topics of interest. Simply:

  1. Open the search window
  2. Enter the desired topic
  3. Click on the relevant resource to view the corresponding content.

Should you encounter any difficulties in finding a specific topic, we encourage you to submit a request through our user feedback page.

 

Product Specific Page

Release Calendar

I am also happy to announce that the release calendar within the Product Specific page has been revamped with a fresh design. It now offers a more detailed view of the release schedule, allowing you to see the specific week when releases will be made available to customers. This granular insight enables you to plan and prepare more effectively for upcoming updates.

 

General Page

Content Structure

We have restructured the General page to better serve your needs. It is now organized by SAP Activate phases, providing clear guidance on when to utilize specific resources during each phase. This alignment with the Road Map Viewer is designed to enhance your navigation experience and ensure you have the right information at the right time.

 

About this Card

I would also like to highlight an additional feature on the General page that enhances your understanding of each resource. You can now access more information about each resource by simply selecting the triple dot icon located at the bottom of each card. This toggle function allows you to reveal or hide further details as needed, ensuring you have all the relevant information at your fingertips.

 

This section provides information regarding the release navigator only. For more detailed information on product release dates, please refer to the Release Calendar card on the Product Specific page.

 Disclaimer: These dates are for informational purposes only and may change. The Readiness@Scale team has the final decision over any UX modifications. Thank you for understanding.

 

We value your input and encourage you to share any feedback or specific content requests for future updates to the release navigator. Please feel free to complete our feedback survey or contribute your suggestions in the Comments section below this post.

To explore more about how the Readiness@Scale team is dedicated to overseeing release readiness within the SAP Enterprise Support portfolio, visit our Release Ready page. Additionally, you can find all our team's blog posts by searching the tag  Readiness@Scale. Thank you for your continued engagement and support.

 

Always bring your best,

Andrew Ford
SAP Enterprise Support

entry.title: Re: Transfer of Planned independent Requirement from head...
entry.content:
,This is not standard SAP behavior.  The different WBS stock segments are independent from one another so you can't have one WBS consume a requirement from another WBS.

You can use Plant Stock or perhaps WBS Requirements Grouping.

entry.content:
When uploading a custom solution process to SAP Cloud ALM  in the Process Authoring App, the template allows for an external reference ID and external reference name to be included in the file for upload.

What am I missing here? Appreciate any assistance from someone who has used this functionality. 

Thanks Carey

entry.title: Re: Third-party libraries in a UI5 TypeScript app
entry.content:
Hi,

when I applied this to my existing UI5 freestyle application, there were three more steps necessary.

1. Add the third party library to dependencies in manifest.json as npm i -D only adds it to devDependencies:

  "ui5": {
    "dependencies": [
      "ui5-middleware-livereload",
      "ui5-tooling-modules"
    ]
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@kenjiuno/msgreader": "^1.26.0-beta1"
  }

2. Ensure that ui5-tooling-modules-task runs after ui5-tooling-transpile-task in the builder section of ui5.yaml (otherwise Component.js and others were not added to the dist folder):

builder:
  customTasks:
  - name: ui5-tooling-transpile-task
    afterTask: replaceVersion
  - name: ui5-tooling-modules-task
    afterTask: ui5-tooling-transpile-task
    configuration:
      prependPathMappings: true

 3. Ensure that ui5-tooling-modules-middleware runs before all other customMiddleware set in the server section of ui5.yaml (all other middlewares had to be set to afterMiddleware = ui5-tooling-modules-middleware):

server:
  customMiddleware:
    - name: ui5-tooling-modules-middleware
      afterMiddleware: compression
    - name: fiori-tools-proxy
      afterMiddleware: ui5-tooling-modules-middleware
# ...

entry.title: Why user is getting a name as Floating Item title instead of curricula name title or item title
Re: Include a field to FIORI app Mass change of purchase...
entry.content:
Follow the below steps

  • Launch the Manage Purchase Orders Fiori app. There apply filters to select the POs you want to update like supplier, date range etc.
  • In the results list, tick the checkboxes for the POs you want to change. You can select multiple POs at once.
  • Click the Export to Spreadsheet icon. Usually, this will be in the top-right toolbar. Choose Export As → Template for Update if available. This ensures the Excel file has the correct structure for re-upload.
  • Open the downloaded excel file. There locate the item-level section in the sheet. Enter the Requisitioner field or any other editable field. If the field is standard and editable in the app, it will be present in the excel template. If it is a custom field, it must be enabled for “Mass Upload” in Custom Fields and Logic.
  • In the Manage Purchase Orders app, choose Import from Spreadsheet. Select your updated excel file. The system will validate the data, any errors will be shown for correction.
  • Validate the data and confirm. The system will apply the changes to all selected POs and items in one go.
  • Some important points you need to take into consideration before you start the above exercise.

In Public Cloud, there is a limitation that you can’t change the excel template structure yourself, only SAP can expose additional fields. If “Requisitioner” is not in the excel template, it means the field is not exposed for mass update in this app. In that case, you’d need to check in Custom Fields and logic if the field is enabled for the business context MM_PURDOC_ITEM and for “UI and Reports”. If it’s a standard field but still missing, it’s a backend limitation, then, you may have to raise an SAP Influence request.

entry.title: Re: Transfer of Planned independent Requirement from head...
entry.content:
In standard S/4HANA including Public Cloud, PIR consumption is WBS-specific. By default, a PIR created for WBS X will only be consumed by requirements like sales orders, dependent requirements, that are pegged to the same WBS element. It will not automatically consume across WBS levels, even if they are in the same project hierarchy — unless you deliberately configure for hierarchical planning.

As you might be knowing Strategy 40 uses requirement type VSF for PIRs and KSV or similar, for sales orders with WBS assignment. In project stock (account assignment category Q), the system keeps requirements and receipts pegged to the exact WBS element. Without special settings, a sales order at level 5 will not “see” PIRs at level 4 — MRP treats them as separate stock segments.

While I am not sure whether my suggestion will work or not, try the below approach to achieve the requirement.

  • Assign a Planning Profile that allows top-down or bottom-up planning in CJ20N. This profile controls whether requirements and receipts can roll up or down the WBS hierarchy. In Public Cloud, you maintain this via the “Manage Project Planning Profiles” app.
  • Use project-based MRP like MD51 or the Fiori equivalent “MRP Run for Project” so the system plans the entire WBS structure together. This allows the system to match demand at level 5 with supply at level 4 if hierarchical planning is active.
  • Ensure the requirement types for PIR and sales order are compatible for consumption (both relevant for strategy 40).
  • Most importantly, both the stock segment type should be same. This means, both PIR and sales order must have either Project Stock or Unrestricted Stock. If one is project stock and the other is common stock, they will never consume each other.

Hello @MelCalucin 

Thank you for your question.

Yes, creating custom CDS views in S/4HANA on-premise or PCE with ABAP Development Tools aligns well with the clean core principle as long as you build these views as extension objects and you do not modify SAP standard code or tables directly.

Please note, SAP recommends you extend through custom objects, BAdIs, APIs, or side-by-side (SAP BTP) for when you want to carry out analytical queries, you want to extract data and when integrating. This ensures you leave the core standard and unchanged.

For more details consult the following link

CDS Views: The Key to a "Clean Core" and a More Agile SAP

Clean core extensibility for SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Extend and Integrate Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Users unable to access remittance advices after upgra...
entry.content:
Hello @kezelda 

Typically, this issue is caused by stricter role restrictions introduced in version 2508.

Key checks:

Use the IAM Information System APP  to verify the required catalogues for Manage Automatic Payments F0770 and Display Payment Runs SAP Help: IAM Information System

In Maintain Business Roles, Review the Restrictions tab carefully. Ensure that the Company Code and related fields are configured correctly. SAP Help: Maintain Business Roles

If the payment run appears for some users but not others, assign a standard SAP template role to an affected user. If it works, the issue is with missing catalogues or overly restrictive restrictions in your custom role.

Background:
In 2508, SAP strengthened the enforcement of restriction fields in several finance applications. Custom role copies created prior to the upgrade might require adjustments.

You can also check the SAP Community blog below

SAP Community-Enterprise Resource Planning Blog Posts by SAP

Let me know if it helps

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Announcing Enhanced “CPU and Memory Consumption Overview” for Private Cloud in SAP for Me Reporting
entry.content:
We are excited to introduce the latest enhancement to the Private Cloud Performance section in the SAP for Me Customer Insights Dashboard — the Memory Consumption Overview. This new feature provides a comprehensive view of Memory utilization, offering valuable insights for capacity management in SAP HANA Enterprise Private Cloud.

Why Memory Consumption Reporting Matters
The Memory Consumption Overview is designed to give you clear visibility into memory usage patterns, helping you pinpoint potential bottlenecks before they impact system performance. Tracking critical periods of high memory usage is essential for understanding the health and scalability of your infrastructure. By monitoring these trends, you can:

  • Understand resource usage patterns
  • Make informed decisions about system upgrades or resizing
  • Proactively respond to performance risks before they affect users

With these capabilities, your team can ensure stable system operation and minimize unexpected downtime.

Expanded Private Cloud Performance Sub-Sections
In addition to the existing “CPU” sub-section, you’ll now find a dedicated “Memory” sub-section. The “Detail” sub-section has also been updated to offer combined insights for both CPU and Memory. Data from the last completed month is available from the 4th day of the following month (e.g. August data available on September 4th).

 

Sub-Section “Memory”

This sub-section enables rapid identification of critical memory consumption trends and measurements across your system landscape. It offers a high-level view of memory utilization for products, systems, and hosts, bringing transparency to ECS service performance and empowering fast, informed decisions.

Memory utilization is monitored hourly and categorized as critical based on the following thresholds. These are the system type and their rating thresholds for critical memory consumption (defined per system type):

  • OTHER: Average Used RAM ≥ 95%
  • ABAP: Average Extended Memory Usage ≥ 90%
  • JAVA: Average Garbage Collector Runtime ≥ 5%
  • HANA: Average Used Memory > 90% OR Free Memory < 50%

Only critical measurements are considered for this overview. The percentage of critical measurements is presented using color-coded ratings for quick assessment:

  • 🟢 Green: <20% Memory Critical Consumption
  • 🟡 Yellow: 20–39% Memory Critical Consumption
  • 🟠 Amber: 40–59% Memory Critical Consumption
  •  🔴 Red: ≥60% Memory Critical Consumption

Like the CPU overview, Memory Critical Consumption is tracked at the software product level, with the highest observed criticality shown from host to system to product.

You can expand the structure for more detailed analysis and easily discover critical hosts.

Please note: The Memory Consumption Overview supports data analysis for capacity planning and optimization, but is not intended for real-time or granular hourly performance monitoring. It is a support tool for Capacity Planning and Infrastructure Optimization decisions.

Analysis Example
In the below example, the host with a red rating recorded 89% Critical Memory consumption measurements in June. In July, ALL average hourly measured values for Memory consumption measurements for this host (belonging to system product SAP S/4HANA and system type ABAP) exceeded 90% for Extended Memory Usage and thus Critical Memory consumption for this month is with 100% and red rating.

Please, bear in mind that for different system types, value for critical Memory Consumption is evaluated based on categorization described above (system types OTHER, ABAP, JAVA and HANA).

Information about values for Color code rating can be shown directly in Overview screen via legend button.

Personalization and Filtering Options
You have flexible options such as changing the default 6-month period or increasing the number of visible lines (default is 15). You can filter to focus on productive systems or refine your results by specific solution area, software product, or system using the top bar filters.

 

Sub-Section “Detail”

The “Detail” sub-section offers a comprehensive, side-by-side view of both CPU and Memory Consumption Trends. These trends are displayed in a stacked column chart, which, for each month, shows the number of hosts grouped by their criticality rating. Above each bar, a line graph represents the total number of hosts for the selected period. Beneath the chart, a detailed table breaks down the data by host and by month, providing granular insight into your system landscape.

This section is fully interactive: when you select a segment in the graph (such as a red or amber segment indicating higher criticality), the table and graph will automatically filter to reflect your selection. Typically, most hosts remain in the green category (low or no critical consumption), but you can easily shift your focus to those with elevated risk.

To enhance your analysis of Memory Consumption:

  • Sort the table by "Memory Critical Avg (%)" in descending order to bring hosts with the highest ratio of critical memory measurements to the top.
  • Select a colored segment directly in the graph to filter both graph and table to those hosts and months.
  • Customize the Memory Consumption Trend graph to focus specifically on hosts with higher (Yellow/Amber/Red) critical consumption ratings. This can be done by excluding green-rated hosts (less than 20% critical measurement), No. of Hosts and hosts with missing memory readings.

For CPU Consumption analysis, similar options are available:

  • Sort the table by "CPU High" in descending order to highlight hosts with the highest proportion of high CPU usage.
  • Select colored segments (like red) in the graph for focused review.
  • Customize the CPU Consumption Trend graph to display only hosts with significant high CPU usage, excluding green-rated hosts (with less than 10% high CPU consumption), gray-rated hosts without CPU reading (No. of Hosts with No CPU Reading) and total number of hosts (No. Hosts).

Note: CPU utilization is measured and rated on physical hosts only (those with Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) in overview). Virtual hosts (those without FQDN) are shown in table without CPU data. Virtual hosts are in default CPU Consumption Trend chart shown as “Gray” segment - No. of Hosts with No CPU Reading.

The filter options in this sub-section allow you to narrow the view by system role (such as “productive systems”) or by time period.

If you wish to focus on specific system types—such as HANA DB hosts—you can enable the relevant filter through the “Adapt Filters” button. Available filters include ‘HANA’, ‘ABAP’, ‘JAVA’, and ‘OTHER’.

The table below the chart is customizable: use the settings (wheel) icon to add or remove columns as needed for your analysis.

Take Advantage of Enhanced Private Cloud Performance Insights
Leverage this enhanced “Private Cloud Performance” area in SAP for Me to gain instant insight into your infrastructure’s health, make informed, data-driven decisions, and proactively optimize your capacity. With these features, your team is better equipped to prevent service interruptions, plan for future growth, and maximize the value of your SAP investment.

SAP for Me is your personalized portal. Stay informed by subscribing to this blog or visiting the SAP Support Portal and the Customer Insights Dashboard for the latest updates.

Related Blogs:

  • “CPU Consumption Overview” Now Live for Private Cloud in SAP for Me Reporting
  • All related blogs for Customer Insights reporting

entry.title: Re: Is it possible to add more than one defect category t...
entry.content:
Hi @RaghavanKathamuthu 

Thank you for your question.

The navigation parameters for Fiori apps Like preferred Mode=create&Defect Category=Z1 only accept one defect category per parameter. You cannot pass multiple values (e.g., Z1 or Z2) in the URL parameter. If you require more than one defect category, you have two options.

You can either: Create separate tiles in the launchpag configuration, each with its own parameter value for you allow the user to select the defect category manually once the app opens.

Consult Record vendor or Customer defect for more details.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: How to enable the Event Mesh from the BTP Integration Suite with S/4 Hana Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi @Hanu,
Just activating the Event Mesh capability inside Integration Suite is not enough.
You will need to create a new service instance of the service SAP Integration Suite with plan messaging-client. Make sure, to provide a Namespace in the configuration json during creation. Finally you'll need to create a Service Key/Service Binding for this instance, to expose the credentials to access the Event Mesh service. These credentials are used to create a channel inside S/4.

@prashantrakheja33 has published a blog how to do the configuration in a S/4HANA On-Premise system. Take this as a starting point. Once you have the Service Key available, you can follow this documentation.    

Best regards,
Tobias

entry.title: Re: "Could Not Open App" Error in SAP Mobile Start Androi...
entry.content:
Hi @ItsMeGopi

From your screenshots, I can see that the semantic object/action mapping is available. Note the section supported devices says desktop is enabled, mobile is not checked. This is the reason why the tile works on desktop but fails to open on Android Mobile Start.

For your content manager synchronisation, even though the content is refreshed and imported successfully, the device type assignment in work zone is not automatically mobile enable for all remote apps.

To resolve the issue, under your supported device, ensure that the phone and tablet icons are checked in addition to the desktop. Save it, republish the site and then finally refresh the content on your mobile start app. Consider clearing cache. This ensure that mobile start recognises the app as mobile-enabled and can resolve the inbound navigation target.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Which technologies are used to develop travel apps?
entry.content:
Travel app development involves a mix of front-end, back-end, and third-party technologies to create a smooth and user-friendly experience. The exact stack can vary depending on the app’s complexity (like booking platforms, itinerary planners, or travel guides), but here are some commonly used technologies:

🔹 Frontend (Mobile & Web):

  • iOS apps: Swift or Objective-C

  • Android apps: Kotlin or Java

  • Cross-platform: Flutter (Dart), React Native (JavaScript), or Xamarin

  • Web apps: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, with frameworks like React.js, Angular, or Vue.js

🔹 Backend:

  • Languages/Frameworks: Node.js, Python (Django/Flask), Ruby on Rails, Java (Spring Boot), or PHP (Laravel)

  • Databases: MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Firebase Realtime Database

  • APIs: REST or GraphQL for communication between frontend and backend

🔹 Third-party APIs & Services:

  • Maps & Navigation: Google Maps API, Mapbox

  • Flight/Hotel Bookings: Amadeus, Skyscanner, Booking.com APIs

  • Payment Gateways: Stripe, PayPal, Razorpay

  • Weather & Local Info: OpenWeatherMap, Yelp, TripAdvisor APIs

🔹 Other Tools:

  • Push Notifications: Firebase Cloud Messaging, OneSignal

  • Authentication: Firebase Auth, OAuth, Auth0

  • Cloud Hosting: AWS, Google Cloud, Azure

These technologies work together to support features like real-time booking, location tracking, travel recommendations, itinerary planning, user reviews, and more.

So, whether you're building a basic city guide or a full-scale travel booking app, choosing the right tech stack is key to delivering a great user experience.

entry.title: Re: How to show CGST, SGST and IGST separately in Adobe F...
entry.content:
To meet your requirement of showing CGST, SGST, and IGST separately, check if the fields are already available in the standard data source. In Public Cloud, you cannot directly change the CDS view and the form SDBIL_CI_STANDARD_IN is bound to a pre-delivered CDS view.

So what you can do is use the Custom Fields and Logic app to see if the tax split fields are released for the business context Sales: Billing Document. If SAP has already exposed Tax Type and Tax Amount at item level, you can bind them directly in Adobe LiveCycle Designer without backend coding. In India GST localization, the tax type codes (JICG, JISG, JIIG) are often available in the billing document item tax table (PRCD_ELEMENTS equivalent in CDS). If these fields are not exposed, you cannot enhance the CDS view directly, but you can create a Custom CDS View (type: External API) joining Billing document item and Item tax details (with tax type).

Filter or group by Tax Type to get CGST, SGST, IGST amounts separately. Expose this custom CDS view as a Custom Business Object or via Custom Fields and logic so it can be consumed in the form. In Output Management Form Template app copy SDBIL_CI_STANDARD_IN to a custom form. Add new fields bound to your extended data source.

entry.title: Re: SAP Business Data Cloud Series – Part 3: Customer-Managed Data Products
entry.content:
@jeetendrakapase 

Thank you for the excellent blog on custom data product generation and sharing.
Let’s take the following scenario:
Step 1: Data Extraction
Extract sales order details from S/4 (fields: SO, ITEM, MAT, DATE, CONFIRMED_QTY, DELIVERED_QTY).

Step 2: Data Onboarding (S/4 → Datasphere Object Store)
Onboard extracted data into the Datasphere object store using replication flows.
Replication flows can handle native mappings (e.g., date → string(8)) or template-based mappings (e.g., date → date type).
Problem scenario: If the source system provides invalid values (e.g., .00.0000 instead of YYYYMMDD), replication flows will fail.
Example: ACDOCA with millions of invalid date records.
Question: How can we fix this situation?

Step 3: Raw → Normal Space (Disk + Memory)
Share the raw table from the object store into a normal space (with disk + memory enabled). Perform:
Data harmonization
Data jobs (e.g., unions, mappings)
Calculated columns
Currency conversions

Step 4: Normal → Data Mart Space
Share the harmonized fact table into a data mart space. Perform:
Business transformations
Association of facts with dimensions, texts, hierarchies
Currency conversion and exceptional aggregation
Global restricted & calculated columns

Step 5: Data Product Publishing (Data Mart Layer)
Publish the data product from the data mart layer instead of the object store.
Advantages:
Ability to use currency conversion, associations, and exceptional aggregations.
Better semantic layer for consumption.

Open Questions
Disk + Memory Spaces
Is it possible to create a data product from a space that uses disk + memory (instead of memory-only)?
Integration Hours Calculation
How to calculate the integration effort (hours) required to replicate data from S/4 to a space with disk + memory or to the object store?
Incorrect Data Handling
How can we correct invalid dates or field values (e.g., .00.0000 in date fields) when loading data from S/4 to Datasphere?
Since replication flows (RF) cannot handle such corrections directly, what is the best practice for remediation?

Thank you so much in Advance.

entry.title: Re: Advanced Valuation - Impairment - Reconciliation Account
entry.content:
No not in standard Public Cloud configuration. There is no delivered option in the Advanced Valuation to override the reconciliation account from the BP master with an alternative G/L account. The reconciliation account is always taken from the customer master data because the posting is made to the subledger (customer account), not just to a G/L account. Changing the reconciliation account at posting time would break the link between the subledger and G/L.

You cannot change the posting logic via classic substitution or BAdI in FI-GL in Public Cloud. For some reasons, if you want the postings to go to a different reconciliation account, you would have to maintain a BP with that reconciliation account and use it for the relevant transactions. But, in general, we do not follow this practice.

Run the impairment posting as standard (offset to the BP recon account). Then use a manual or automated reclassification journal to move the balance from the BP recon account to your desired G/L account for reporting purposes.

This SAP Help Post Credit-Risk-Based Impairment  confirms that in the Define Rules for Impairment step you can only choose the P/L account; the offset is always the receivable’s reconciliation account from the BP master. There is no configuration point for a “deviating recon account” in Public Cloud.
